input_data.title: Tulsa King
input_data.overview: Just after he is released from prison after 25 years, New York mafia capo Dwight “The General” Manfredi is unceremoniously exiled by his boss to set up shop in Tulsa, Okla. Realizing that his mob family may not have his best interests in mind, Dwight slowly builds a “crew” from a group of unlikely characters, to help him establish a new criminal empire in a place that to him might as well be another planet.

response.analytical_summary: Tulsa King is a crime drama centered on a seasoned New York mobster unexpectedly relocated to Tulsa, Oklahoma. The series explores themes of adaptation, cultural clash, and the challenges of building a criminal enterprise in unfamiliar territory. It blends elements of crime procedural with character-driven storytelling, offering a darkly comedic and often poignant look at a man struggling to reconcile his old-world values with a new environment. The show's tone is a mix of gritty realism and wry humor, examining the complexities of loyalty, ambition, and the search for belonging.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: Following his release from prison after a quarter-century, Dwight Manfredi, a respected New York mafia capo, is exiled to Tulsa, Oklahoma, by his boss, Charlie. Initially intending to simply establish a basic criminal operation, Dwight quickly realizes that Tulsa presents unique challenges and opportunities. He begins assembling a crew of local misfits, including a former insurance salesman and a skilled mechanic, to help him navigate the unfamiliar landscape. As Dwight attempts to build his criminal empire, he encounters resistance from local gangs and corrupt officials, forcing him to adapt his tactics and forge uneasy alliances. The series follows Dwight's efforts to gain a foothold in Tulsa's underworld, while simultaneously uncovering a larger conspiracy that threatens his mission and exposes secrets about his past. Throughout the season, Dwight grapples with the cultural differences between New York and Tulsa, and the moral compromises necessary to survive in a new environment, ultimately reshaping his understanding of family, loyalty, and power.
response.keyword_sentence: Tulsa King is a darkly comic crime drama about a seasoned New York mobster adapting to a new life and criminal enterprise in the American South, exploring themes of loyalty, power, and the challenges of building a family in an unfamiliar world.
